TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SiteMapDataSourceView extends System.Web.UI.DataSourceView

Docs.summary: Provides a strongly typed object for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> control enables ASP.NET data-bound controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> controls, to bind to site map data. The SiteMapDataSourceView class is used by controls developers but it is not used by page developers nor in page code.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> returns a SiteMapDataSourceView for a specified hierarchical path when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView.Select%2A> method is called. Like all hierarchical data source view objects, the SiteMapDataSourceView is not named; rather, its is identified by its unique hierarchical path.
The SiteMapDataSourceView is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable> interface, which the SiteMapDataSourceView class returns from a call to `Select` method. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> and SiteMapDataSourceView work with <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNode> objects, the view maintains an internal <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> to contain them. The collection is initialized using the view's constructors and accessed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public SiteMapDataSourceView (System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource owner, string name, System.Web.SiteMapNode node);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource owner, string name, class System.Web.SiteMapNode node) cil managed

Docs.param: The that the is associated with.
The to add to the internal .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new named instance of the class, adding the single specified node to the internal collection of nodes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> object. Creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> using the SiteMapDataSourceView constructor initializes the internal node collection with a single <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNode> object. The site map structure is navigated using the node as a point of reference.

MemberSignature.Value: public SiteMapDataSourceView (System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource owner, string name, System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection collection);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource owner, string name, class System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection collection) cil managed

Docs.param: The that the is associated with.
A of nodes that the provides a view of.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new named instance of the class, setting the internal collection of nodes to the specified node collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> object. Creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> using the SiteMapDataSourceView constructor initializes the internal node collection with the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> that is passed to the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable ExecuteSelect(class System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments arguments) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is used to request operations on the data beyond basic data retrieval.
Docs.summary: Gets the collection of the objects that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.
Docs.returns: A that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class implements the inherited ExecuteSelect method to retrieve a set of nodes that represents the site navigation structure for the current ASP.NET application. Page developers and data-bound control authors do not call the ExecuteSelect method directly; instead, use the publicly exposed <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnDataSourceViewChanged(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable Select(class System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments arguments) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is used to request operations on the data beyond basic data retrieval.
Docs.summary: Gets the collection of the objects that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.
Docs.returns: A that represents the site navigation structure for the current user.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Select method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method, passing the `arguments` parameter. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method is used by controls developers but it is not used by page developers nor in page code.

Docs.exception: The passed to the Select specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.
